com.pcmiler.routing
Class TripInterface

java.lang.Object
  com.pcmiler.routing.TripInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalTrip
public abstract class TripInterface
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the interface to the PC*MILER routing engine. It can be sub-classed to provide different implementation of the routing and data servers.

Constructor Detail

TripInterface

public TripInterface()
This constructor initializes the route options and noting more. The implementation of this abstract class should do all other initialization.

Method Detail

getTripID

public abstract int getTripID()
This function returns the trip's server identification number. It is used to identify the trip to the mapping engine.

Returns:
The trip's ID number in the server.

dispose

public abstract void dispose()
This function informs the server that this trip is no longer being used, and that its resources can be freed.

getOptions

public RouteOptions getOptions()
This function returns the route options associated with the current route.

Returns:
The route options.

public void setOptions(RouteOptions opts)
                throws RoutingException
This function sets the options for a route based on a given RouteOptions object.

Parameters:
opts - The RouteOptions object containing the options to be used.

RoutingException

PCMAddStop

public abstract void PCMAddStop(GResultsInterface results,
                                int which)
                         throws RoutingException,
                                java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
This function add the specified match from the result set as a stop at the end of the current trip

Parameters:
results - The geocode results object that contains the match to add.
which - The index into the result set.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while adding the stop to the trip
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the result set.

                                   int which,
                                   int pos)
                            throws RoutingException,
                                   java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Parameters:
results - The geocode results object that contains the match to add.
which - The index into the result set.
pos - The postion at which to insert the stop.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while adding the stop to the trip
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the result set.

PCMClearStops

public abstract void PCMClearStops()
                            throws RoutingException
This function empties the trip, removing all of the stops.

Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while deleting all of the stops.

PCMResequenceStops

public abstract void PCMResequenceStops()
                                 throws RoutingException
This function resquences the stops of the trip in such a way as to minimize total distance. The first stop of the trip is always maintained. The last stop can either be fixed, or reordered depending on the value passed to setResequence().

Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while resequencing the route.
See Also:
PCMSetResequence(boolean)

PCMSetResequence

public abstract void PCMSetResequence(boolean destFixed)
                               throws RoutingException
This function specifies whether the final stop in a route should remain fixed when the route is resquenced.

Parameters:
destFixed - true if the first and the final stop should be fixed when resequencing, or false if only the first stop should be fixed.
Throws:
RoutingException - There was an error while setting the option
See Also:
PCMResequenceStops()

PCMCalculate

public abstract int PCMCalculate()
                          throws RoutingException
This function runs the current trip, calculating distance and times.

Returns:
The distance of the route.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while running the route.

public abstract java.lang.String PCMGetStop(int which)
                                     throws RoutingException,
                                            java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Parameters:
which - The index into the trip
Returns:
The given stop as a single string.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the stop information
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the trip.

PCMNumStops

public abstract int PCMNumStops()
                         throws RoutingException
This function returns the number of stops currently in the route.

Returns:
The number of stops in the trip.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while retrieving the number of stops.

PCMGetFormattedStop

public abstract java.lang.String[] PCMGetFormattedStop(int which)
                                                throws RoutingException,
                                                       java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
This function returns a stop from the trip as a series of strings. If x is the returned array, x[0] is the city name, x[1] is the state, x[2] is the zipcode, and x[3] is the county. If available, x[4] is the address part of the stop. If this information is not available, x[4] is equal to "". Constants to access these fields are defined in TripInterface.

Parameters:
which - The index into the trip
Returns:
The given stop as an array of strings.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the stop information
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the trip.
See Also:
CITY_FIELD, STATE_FIELD, ZIP_FIELD, COUNTY_FIELD, ADDR_FIELD

PCMLookup

public abstract GResultsInterface PCMLookup(java.lang.String stop,
                                            boolean pickExact)
                                     throws RoutingException
This function takes and input string and geocodes it. The pickExact parameter controls how matching is done. If it is set to true, only an exact match will be selected, otherwise an empty set is returned. If it is set to false, all possible matches are returned.

Parameters:
stop - The string to be geocoded.
pickExact - Determines whether an exact match is required
Returns:
A GResultsInterface object representing the results of the lookup.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error occured while geocoding.

PCMNumMatches

public abstract int PCMNumMatches(GResultsInterface results)
                           throws RoutingException
This function returns the number of matches for a given result set.

Parameters:
results - The geocode results object to get the information from.
Returns:
The number of matches.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the information

                                             int which)

                                             java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

PCMGetFormatMatch

public abstract java.lang.String[] PCMGetFormatMatch(GResultsInterface results,
                                                     int which)
                                              throws RoutingException,
                                                     java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
This function returns a given match as an array of strings from a geocode result set. If x is the returned array, x[0] is the city name, x[1] is the state, x[2] is the zipcode, and x[3] is the county. If available, x[4] is the address part of the stop. If this information is not available, x[4] is equal to "". Constants to access these fields are defined in TripInterface.

Parameters:
results - The geocode results object to get the information from.
which - The index into the result set
Returns:
The given match as a array of strings.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the information
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the result set.
See Also:
CITY_FIELD, STATE_FIELD, ZIP_FIELD, COUNTY_FIELD, ADDR_FIELD

PCMGetLegInfo

public abstract java.lang.String[] PCMGetLegInfo(int leg)
                                          throws RoutingException,
                                                 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
This function returns the time and distance information for a given leg in the trip. It is returned as a six-part array. Array[0] is the distance covered in the leg. Array [1] is the cumalitive distance up through this leg. The units of distance are determined by the route options. Array[2] is the cost of the leg. Cost is figured by multiplying the mileage by a cost per mile specified in the route options. Array[3] is the cumulative cost of the trip. Array[4] is the approximate time needed to travel the leg. Array[5] is total ammount of time in the trip so far. Constants to access these fields are defined in TripInterface.

Parameters:
leg - The leg for which information is desired, should be between 0 and numStops-2
Returns:
The leg information.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the stop information
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the trip.
See Also:
LEG_DIST, TOT_DIST, LEG_COST, TOT_COST, LEG_TIME, TOT_TIME

PCMGetNumRows

public abstract int PCMGetNumRows(java.lang.String rptType)
                           throws RoutingException
This function is one of a group of four, allowing reports to be retrieved cell-by-cell. This returns the number of rows in the given report. The type of report is specified using contants defined in TripInterface.

Parameters:
rptType - The type of report.
Returns:
The number of rows in the report.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the report information
See Also:
DETAIL_RPT, STATE_RPT

Returns:
The number of columns in the report.

RoutingException - An error getting the report information

PCMGetRptCellText

public abstract java.lang.String PCMGetRptCellText(java.lang.String rptType,
                                                   int rowNum,
                                                   int colNum)
                                            throws RoutingException,
                                                   java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
This function is one of a group of four, allowing reports to be retrieved cell-by-cell. This returns the text of a cell specified by rowNum and colNum.

Parameters:
rptType - The type of report.
rowNum - The row coordinate of the cell.
colNum - The column coordinate of the cell.
Returns:
The contents of the given cell.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the report information
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the trip.
See Also:
DETAIL_RPT, STATE_RPT

PCMGetRptCellStyle

public abstract java.lang.String PCMGetRptCellStyle(java.lang.String rptType,
                                                    int rowNum,
                                                    int colNum)
                                             throws RoutingException,
                                                    java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
This function is one of a group of four, allowing reports to be retrieved cell-by-cell. This returns a textual description of the style of a cell specified by rowNum and colNum. This information can be used to format the report, if desired.

Parameters:
rptType - The type of report.
rowNum - The row coordinate of the cell.
colNum - The column coordinate of the cell.
Returns:
The contents of the given cell.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error getting the report information
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The which parameter is not a valid index into the trip.
See Also:
DETAIL_RPT, STATE_RPT

                                        throws RoutingException

Parameters:
rptType - The type of report to generate
Returns:
The HTML formatted report.
Throws:
RoutingException - An error while generating the report

DETAIL_RPT, STATE_RPT

PCMSetRoutingType

public abstract void PCMSetRoutingType(int type)
                                throws RoutingException

type - The routing type to be used by the route.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred while setting the routing type.
RoutingException
See Also:
RouteOptions.ROUTING_PRACTICAL, RouteOptions.ROUTING_SHORTEST, RouteOptions.ROUTING_NATIONAL, RouteOptions.ROUTING_TOLL, RouteOptions.ROUTING_53FT

PCMSetHub

public abstract void PCMSetHub(boolean hub)
                        throws RoutingException
This function determines whether the trip is in hub mode or not.

Parameters:
hub - true to use hub mode, false to use regular mode.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred setting the hub mode option.
RoutingException

PCMGetHub

public abstract boolean PCMGetHub()
                           throws RoutingException
This function returns whether the trip is in hub mode or not.

Returns:
true if in hub mode, false if not.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred getting the hub mode value.
RoutingException

PCMSetUnits

public abstract void PCMSetUnits(int units)
                          throws RoutingException
This function sets the unit of measurement to be used by the trip. The constants for the parameter are defined in the RouteOptions class.

Parameters:
units - The unit of measurement to be used by the route, one of RouteOptions.UNITS_KM or RouteOptions.UNITS_MILE
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred while setting the units.
RoutingException
See Also:
RouteOptions.UNITS_KM, RouteOptions.UNITS_MILE

PCMGetUnits

                         throws RoutingException
This function returns the unit of measurement used by the trip. The constants for the return values are defined in the RouteOptions class.

Returns:
The unit of measurement used by the route.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred getting the units.
RoutingException
See Also:
RouteOptions.UNITS_KM, RouteOptions.UNITS_MILE

PCMSetBordersOpen

public abstract void PCMSetBordersOpen(boolean borders)
                                throws RoutingException
This function determines whether the trip uses open borders option. A value of true allows the routing engine to cross international boundaries. A value of false restricts the routing engine from crossing international boundaries if at all possible.

Parameters:
borders - The value for border crossing.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred setting the hub mode option.
RoutingException

PCMGetBordersOpen

public abstract boolean PCMGetBordersOpen()
                                   throws RoutingException
Returns the value of the borders open option. If the borders are specified as open, the routing engine will freely cross international boundaries.

Returns:
The borders open option.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred getting the hub mode value.
RoutingException

PCMSetRptOrder

public abstract void PCMSetRptOrder(int order)
                             throws RoutingException
This function sets the order in which states are reported in a state report.

Parameters:
order - The value for the report order.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred setting the state report order.
RoutingException
See Also:
RouteOptions.REPORT_BY_STATE, RouteOptions.REPORT_BY_ORDER

PCMGetRptOrder

public abstract int PCMGetRptOrder()
                            throws RoutingException
This function returns the order in which states are listed in the state report. The REPORT_BY_STATE option lists the states in alphabetical order, while the REPORT_BY_ORDER lists the states in the order

Returns:
The order in which states are listed.
Throws:
com.pcmiler.RoutingException - An error occurred getting the hub mode value.
RoutingException
